name: Enterprise techniques used in AI-obfuscated Phishing Campaign (2025, Microsoft Threat Intelligence)
description: Most important enterprise TTPs observed in the 2025 AI-obfuscated phishing campaign utilizing SVG, AI-generated obfuscation, and social engineering, as analyzed by Microsoft Threat Intelligence.

techniques.comment: Phishing emails sent from a compromised business account, containing an SVG masquerading as a PDF, intended to steal credentials via credential phishing.
Compromised small business email account used as sender to distribute phishing emails and increase legitimacy.
SVG payload obfuscated with invisible chart elements and encoded business terminology, supported by AI-generated code structure and variable naming.
Self-sending emails with victim addresses hidden in BCC field for recipient anonymization and to bypass basic security heuristics.
User-executed malicious SVG file, appearing as a PDF document, leveraged to entice victim to open in browser, triggering embedded JavaScript.
JavaScript embedded in SVG file runs in the victim's browser, decoding the obfuscated payload, managing redirect, and session logic.
Malicious redirect upon file open—SVG triggers redirect to external phishing page leveraging a previously flagged malicious domain.
Browser redirect facilitates connection to attacker-controlled infrastructure, for command/control and post-exploitation steps.
Credential harvesting: Phishing website likely presented a fake sign-in page after CAPTCHA to steal user credentials.
CAPTCHA on phishing landing page applied as social engineering to build trust, block automation, and increase victim compliance.
Phishing site session tracking used to enhance attack targeting, restrict content delivery to intended victims, and evade automated analysis.
Browser fingerprinting and environment awareness leveraged by phishing site to serve targeted content and evade automated sandboxes.
Masquerading: Email and attachment crafted to appear as file-sharing notifications with an attachment mimicking a PDF (but actually SVG).
